title: The Traumatic Kidnapping Case Behind Netflix’s American Nightmare Docuseries
description: Netflix's new docuseries chronicles law enforcement's mishandling of a kidnapping case police framed as a 'real-life Gone Girl.'

title: Montana Supreme Court Upholds Landmark Ruling From Youth Climate Case
description: Montana's Supreme Court rejects attempt to block a ruling that said regulators must consider emissions when issuing fossil fuel permits.

title: Judge Denies Request to Dismiss Case Against Man Charged in NYC Subway Chokehold Death
description: Daniel Penny has pleaded not guilty to his charges in the NYC subway death of Jordan Neely.

title: Judge Threatens to Boot Trump From Courtroom Over Loud Talking as E. Jean Carroll Testifies
description: Trump repeatedly ignored a warning to be quiet while writer E. Jean Carroll testified during his Manhattan civil trial.

title: The Surprising Voters Driving Trump to Victory
description: Under Trump the shape of the GOP coalition has changed dramatically—and in ways that make his success in 2020 even likelier.

title: U.S. Puts Houthis Rebels Back on List of Global Terrorists
description: The sanctions that come with the formal designation are meant to sever extremist groups from sources of financing.

title: How MAGA Hijacked the Conservative Movement
description: Author Tina Nguyen on her new book 'The MAGA Diaries.'

title: Arctic Blast to Hit the U.S Again as First One Ends
description: As of Wednesday, the Northeast was experiencing below freezing temperatures.

title: What to Know About Complementary Treatments for Lupus
description:
Experts say therapies like mindfulness
and biofeedback can be beneficial
for people living with lupus.

title: New Polling Shows How Much Global Support Israel Has Lost
description: Research from Morning Consult shows that favorable views of Israel have declined in 42 of 43 countries polled since the war in Gaza began.

title: How Long Does It Take to Get COVID-19? Here’s What a New Study Says
description: Here's what a new study says

title: King Charles to Undergo Treatment for Enlarged Prostate
description: King Charles III will undergo a procedure to correct his enlarged prostate, Buckingham Palace announced.

title: OpenAI Working With U.S. Military on Cybersecurity Tools
description: OpenAI is developing open-source cybersecurity software tools with the U.S. Defense Department

title: Utah to Revise Social Media Limits for Youth as Lawsuits Loom
description: Utah's Republican legislative leaders are prioritizing revisions to new social media youth protection laws to ensure they hold up in court.

title: Princess Kate Hospitalized For Up to Two Weeks After Planned Abdominal Surgery
description: Kate, the Princess of Wales, will be hospitalized after planned abdominal surgery for the next ten to fourteen days, per Kensington Palace.

title: Here’s Why Guinness World Records Has Suspended Bobi’s ‘World’s Oldest Dog’ Title
description: Bobi was crowned the world’s oldest dog by Guinness World Records in 2023, but some experts have now cast doubt on his age.

title: U.K. Inflation Unexpectedly Rises After Cost of Tobacco Increases. What to Know
description: Inflation in the U.K. rose in December, contradicting earlier predictions and spelling trouble for politicians in power.

title: History Suggests U.S. Airstrikes Against the Houthis Will Backfire
description: Foreign powers have long failed to achieve military objectives in Yemen, and attacks on the Houthis will likely enhance their popularity.

title: Nigeria Explosion Kills 3 and Injures 77 as Buildings Collapse
description: Three people died and 77 were injured after a blast caused by explosives rocked more than 20 buildings in one of Nigeria's largest cities.

title: How Rocky Presidential Transitions Put America at Risk
description: "National security is too important to leave to chance or poor planning," writes Christopher Liddell.

title: The Power of Changing Your Mind
description: Propaganda works best when it creates apathy. But we must remember to never look away, writes Hala Alyan.

title: U.K. Leader Rishi Sunak Tries to Quell Conservative Revolt Over Rwanda Migrant Plan
description: U.K. Prime Minister Rishi Sunak faces a test of his authority as he tries to win parliamentary approval for his stalled Rwanda migrant plan.

title: Qatar and France Broker Deal to Send Medicine to Hostages in Gaza as War Rages On
description: A shipment of medicine for dozens of hostages held by Hamas was en route to Gaza on Wednesday after France and Qatar mediated an agreement.

title: The SEC Is at the Mercy of the Courts at a Perilous Moment
description: A series of cases could challenge the SEC's authority to regulate and enforce a wide scope of American economic life.

title: Filmmakers in Malaysia Charged With Offending Religious Feelings in Banned Film
description: The director and producer of ‘Mentega Terbang’ are being criminally prosecuted in Malaysia in what critics slam as an attack on freedom of expression.

title: Here’s How China Has Responded to Countries Congratulating Taiwan’s Election Winner
description: Not positively.

title: Pakistan Can Keep Imran Khan Out of Power, But It Can’t Keep His Popularity Down
description: The country’s military kingmakers can keep former Prime Minister Imran Khan out of power, but they can’t keep his popularity down.

title: Hong Kong No Longer Has the World’s Longest Life Expectancy
description: The city relinquished its crown to Japan as Covid and overall stress weighs on local lifespans.

title: China’s Population Shrinks Some More—Decrease in Births, Increase in Deaths in 2023
description: New government data reveals that China’s population shrunk by some 2 million last year—with a continued drop in births and a rise in deaths.

title: 2024 Is a Pivotal Year on the Brink
description: Ray Dalio on the five forces shaping 2024 that we need to focus on to measure risk.

title: Biden Admin to Relist Yemen’s Houthi Rebels as ‘Specially Designated Global Terrorists’
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken delisted the Houthis as a foreign terrorist organization in February 2021 as the administration sought to make it easier to get humanitarian aid into Yemen.
